title: The Beloved's Visit
shortSummary: Song of Solomon Chapter 5 depicts an intimate and emotional encounter between the bride and her beloved. The chapter highlights themes of longing, love, and the pain of separation, culminating in a vivid poetic description of the beloved’s beauty and worth. It emphasizes the deep affection and desire within the covenant of love.
timeline: c. 10th century BC - Period of Solomon’s reign

keyCharacters.name: The Bride
keyCharacters.description: The female protagonist who expresses longing and love for her beloved, experiencing both joy and sorrow in their relationship.

keyCharacters.name: The Beloved
keyCharacters.description: The male figure, often understood as the bridegroom or Christ-figure, who seeks intimate fellowship with the bride and is described with exalted beauty.

keyCharacters.name: The Daughters of Jerusalem
keyCharacters.description: Chorus-like figures who serve as witnesses and confidantes to the bride, offering a communal voice in the narrative.

keyCharacters.name: The Watchmen
keyCharacters.description: City guards who find and mistreat the bride during her search for the beloved, symbolizing opposition or hardship.

definitions.definition: A fragrant resin used in perfumes and incense, symbolizing sweetness and preciousness in biblical poetry.
A piece of cloth worn by women, often symbolizing modesty or protection; its removal here indicates vulnerability.
A precious stone mentioned in the Bible, representing beauty and value.
A biblical symbol of purity, love, and gentleness, used here as a term of endearment.

outline.heading: Invitation to Feast and Fellowship
outline.description: The bridegroom invites the bride and her friends to partake in the delights of the garden, symbolizing joy and intimate communion.

outline.heading: The Beloved’s Knock and the Bride’s Hesitation
outline.description: The beloved calls at the door, but the bride struggles with hesitation and delay, illustrating the tension between desire and fear.

outline.heading: The Beloved’s Departure and the Bride’s Distress
outline.description: After the bride opens the door, the beloved withdraws, leaving her in anguish and prompting her to seek him earnestly, expressing the pain of separation.

outline.heading: The Daughters’ Inquiry and the Bride’s Affirmation
outline.description: The daughters of Jerusalem question the bride about her beloved’s uniqueness, leading to a confident declaration of his excellence.

outline.heading: The Beloved’s Glorious Description
outline.description: A rich poetic portrayal of the beloved’s physical beauty and character, emphasizing his worthiness and the bride’s deep affection.

application: Cherish and pursue intimate fellowship with Christ, recognizing the joy and sweetness found in His presence.
Respond promptly and faithfully to the Lord’s calling, avoiding hesitation that can lead to missed blessings.
In times of spiritual dryness or separation, earnestly seek the Lord through prayer and reliance on His promises.
Recognize the incomparable beauty and worth of Christ, allowing this truth to deepen your love and devotion.

keyVerses.text: I sleep, but my heart waketh: it is the voice of my beloved that knocketh, saying, Open to me, my sister, my love, my dove, my undefiled: for my head is filled with dew, and my locks with the drops of the night.
keyVerses.significance: This verse captures the tender call of the beloved and the bride’s spiritual awakening to His presence.

keyVerses.text: I opened to my beloved; but my beloved had withdrawn himself, and was gone: my soul failed when he spake: I sought him, but I could not find him; I called him, but he gave me no answer.
keyVerses.significance: It expresses the pain of separation and the longing for the beloved, reflecting the believer’s experience in times of spiritual trial.

keyVerses.text: His mouth is most sweet: yea, he is altogether lovely. This is my beloved, and this is my friend, O daughters of Jerusalem.
keyVerses.significance: This verse summarizes the bride’s profound love and admiration for her beloved, affirming his perfect beauty and friendship.
